title: Can't play YouTube "shorts" on  FF 132.0 (64-bit) Windows 11, but Chrome plays them fine
content:
I switched to using Firefox about six weeks ago, from Chrome. At first, it all worked perfectly. Now, I have a 100% reproducable problem: YouTube "short" videos never play. It will display the video player in the proper aspect ratio, and displays the overlayed text from the video's thumbnail and other meta data, but the actual playing of the video fails with a message typically like:

An error occurred. Please try again later. (Playback ID: C8SVj-KCLVM2m_DW)

Windows 11, current patched. on serious Core I9 system with 32 GB of ram, fast video card, etc.

Regular YouTube videos display perfectly. Using Google Chrome browser works perfectly.

The help message talks about clearing cache, but I can't seem to find that. I can see how to delete site-specific cookies and data. I really don't want to clear all cookies for all sites.
creator: pat22043

title: ERROR:  Platform Version 132.0.1 is not compatible with miniversion >= 132.0 or maxversion >=132.0  Maybe try to reinstall Foxfire?
content:
I went to use Foxfire this morning, it had an update for me, I clicked on it......and FIREFOX DISAPPEARED ! It then gave me the above notification. Also, now when I click on my Firefox Icon, it shows me a blank form that is trying to load something on it, over and over and over........

I have refreshed, tried troubleshooting, restarted several times, etc, etc. I am afraid to try reloading Firefox for fear of losing all of my data....passwords, library, bookmarks, downloads, etc...etc.

Now what do I do?????

Thanking you in advance.......Janice in northern Minnesota, near the Canadian border.......

title: Não é possível utilizar acentos em jogos Unity no Firefox para Linux/Ubuntu
content:
Olá, comunidade Firefox! Gostaria de saber se alguém tem o mesmo problema que eu, com relação a jogos Unity no Firefox para Linux. Jogo Habbo Hotel, um jogo web que roda em Unity, quase que nativo em todos os navegadores modernos, e utilizo o Firefox no Ubuntu 24.10. Algo curioso é que, no jogo, não estou conseguindo digitar acentos (á, é, ú, ão, etc), mesmo com o Firefox e os pacotes de idioma PT-BR atualizados. Consigo digitar acentos normalmente pelo Chrome/Chromium, Opera, Vivaldi e outros, o problema só ocorre no Firefox para Linux. Sim, tentei rodar a versão Debian (.deb) do Firefox ao invés do snap, porém o resultado é o mesmo, sem acentos.

Alguém sabe o motivo de isso acontecer?
creator: hugomarceloat

title: HaxBall Performance Issues
content:
SUMMARY Severe performance issues (low FPS) in HaxBall browser game specifically on maps containing hockey floors (vector-heavy content) across multiple Linux desktop environments and display servers. The issue is Firefox-specific, as the game performs normally on Chromium-based browsers under identical conditions.

ENVIRONMENT

Firefox Version: - 132.0

Tested Systems and Configurations: 1) Fedora 41 KDE Plasma 6 

  * X11 display server   * Wayland display server

2) OpenSUSE Tumbleweed KDE Plasma 6 

  * X11 display server   * Wayland display server

3) Fedora 41 MATE-Compiz 

  * X11 display server

4) Fedora 41 Workstation (GNOME) 

  * X11 display server   * Wayland display server

ISSUE DESCRIPTION • The performance degradation is consistent across all tested configurations • Issue specifically manifests in maps with numerous vector elements (hockey floors) • Game is virtually unplayable in vector-heavy maps • Problem is reproducible across different desktop environments and display servers • Performance is optimal in Chromium-based browsers under identical conditions

TEST CASE

Test Map: The performance issues can be reproduced using this test map:

1) Map code: Available as a public Gist: 

  https://gist.github.com/EduMejorado/375a01d16e89fa65807ee73ef8ae1417   * Contains a hockey-type floor with vector elements that trigger the performance issue   * Can be imported directly into HaxBall for testing   * Demonstrates the performance difference between Firefox and Chromium browsers

2) Steps to reproduce: 

  * Download the map from the gist   * Import it into a haxball room   * Load the map in both Firefox and a Chromium-based browser   * Compare the FPS and overall performance between browsers

ATTEMPTED SOLUTIONS

The following solutions have been attempted without success:

1) Hardware Acceleration Related: 

  * Enabled hardware acceleration (layers.acceleration.force-enabled)   * Forced WebGL   * Run with GPU optimization flags

2) Configuration Changes: 

  * Enabled gfx.webrender.all   * Modified various about:config settings

3) Environment Variables: 

  * Tested with various Firefox flags (e.g., MOZ_ENABLE_WAYLAND=0)

4) Profile/Extensions: 

  * Disabled all extensions   * Created new Firefox profile

IMPACT The performance issue makes the game unplayable specifically in Firefox, while the same content performs well in other browsers on identical systems. This suggests a Firefox-specific rendering or performance optimization issue when handling vector-heavy content.
creator: eduinmayy

title: Mouse Sensitivity DPI Issue Only in Firefox
content:
Dear Mozilla Support Team,

I’m experiencing an unusual issue with mouse sensitivity in Firefox. When I open Firefox, my mouse sensitivity or DPI seems to drop significantly, making it difficult to navigate. However, when I close Firefox, my mouse sensitivity returns to its normal level. This issue does not occur in other browsers like Microsoft Edge or Opera, where the DPI remains stable, suggesting the problem is specific to Firefox and not related to my laptop or system settings.

I’ve tried troubleshooting on my end, but the issue persists. Could you please advise on any specific settings or configurations in Firefox that could be causing this DPI sensitivity drop? If this can’t be resolved, I may need to consider uninstalling Firefox and switching to a different browser for a smoother experience.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I appreciate any assistance you can provide.
creator: killersavage217

title: Sugerencia para mejorar la barra lateral en Firefox
content:
Estimado equipo de Mozilla,

Me gustaría sugerir una mejora para la barra lateral de Firefox. Actualmente, esta barra solo permite ver el historial, los marcadores y el nombre de las pestañas sincronizadas. Sin embargo, creo que sería de gran utilidad poder abrir pestañas directamente en la barra lateral, lo que brindaría mayor flexibilidad y comodidad al navegar.

Después de investigar, no he encontrado una opción nativa que permita abrir pestañas en la barra lateral, por lo que me gustaría saber si existe alguna funcionalidad oculta que permita activar esta opción, o si está en planes de ser implementada en futuras actualizaciones de Firefox.

Agradezco de antemano su atención y espero que esta sugerencia sea considerada para mejorar la experiencia de navegación en Firefox.
creator: jyajahuancah
